Navigating the Wild West of Consumer AI

A User's Perspective

02 Mar 2023

By Wikipedia Brown

Letâ€™s be honest, AI is everywhere. It suggests what shows I should binge next, helps me edit photos like a pro, and occasionally tries to sell me things I probably donâ€™t need. As someone who loves to try out new tech, Iâ€™m fascinated by the possibilities of AI but also increasingly wary of the pitfalls that come along with it. Hereâ€™s what keeps me up at night:

Am I being manipulated?

Between targeted ads, recommendation engines, and personalized content, sometimes it feels like AI knows me better than I know myself. Thatâ€™s both cool and concerning. What I worry about is:

The Filter Bubble: Are the algorithms subtly steering me towards specific choices, limiting my exposure to diverse opinions or alternative products?

The Nudge Factor: Sometimes, a well-timed recommendation is helpful, but other times it feels like AI is nudging me to spend money or behave in ways I hadnâ€™t necessarily planned on.

Is my privacy just an illusion?

I get that my data fuels these AI systems, but I feel like Iâ€™ve lost track of who has what information and how itâ€™s being used. Hereâ€™s my concern:

The Creepy Factor: Apps asking for way too many permissions, or my smart speaker seeming to mysteriously â€˜knowâ€™ what I was just talking aboutâ€¦it makes me uneasy.

What Happens When Things Go Wrong: Data breaches are headline news all the time. Iâ€™m not sure my digital footprint is as safe as it should be, and I donâ€™t know what recourse I have if itâ€™s not.

Can I really trust what I see (or hear)?

With AI getting really good at creating fake videos, images, and even text, itâ€™s getting harder to tell whatâ€™s real anymore. My fear is:

Deepfakes Gone Wild: How am I supposed to trust a viral video or news story when it could be completely fabricated? Undermining trust like that is dangerous.

The Battle Against Misinformation: Itâ€™s already hard enough to combat fake news and propaganda. AI-fueled misinformation will make this problem practically unsolvable.

Whereâ€™s the human in the loop?

AI can be incredibly helpful, but there are times I crave that human touch. Whatâ€™s frustrating is:

When AI Falls Short: Often, I find myself stuck in endless loops with chatbots that canâ€™t solve my problem, longing to simply talk to a real person.

AI Isnâ€™t the Answer to Everything: Major life decisions or situations with complex emotions are where I need human empathy and judgment, not just what an algorithm spits out.

What I Want From Consumer AI

Iâ€™m not anti-AI; far from it! I just want it to be better, more responsible. Hereâ€™s my wish list:

Transparency: Tell me how my data is used and why Iâ€™m seeing certain things.

Control: Give me real choices about data sharing and easy-to-understand privacy settings.

Help in Fighting Fakes: I want platforms and tools that actively combat AI-generated misinformation.

The Human Option: Donâ€™t make AI the only way to interact â€“ give me the option for human assistance when I need it.

Itâ€™s a delicate balance â€“ I want the benefits of AI without feeling like a pawn in a giant technological game.
